docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES THE New Deal has caused a pronounced change in the attitude of South Americans toward the United States, or toward North America, as they prefer to call it. Distrust, suspicion and ill-feeling toward the "colossus of the North" had...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES THE New Deal has caused a pronounced change in the attitude of South Americans toward the United States, or toward North America, as they prefer to call it. Distrust, suspicion and ill-feeling toward the "colossus of the North" had become unanimous and intense by the beginning of this year.
docs.abstract: Feature article on trade conditions and on attitude toward U S; illus

headline.main: WATCHFULLY, SOUTH AMERICA WAITS ON US; The New Deal Gave Hope of a New Order, but the Latin Republics Are Still Skeptical as to Trade Benefits

docs.snippet: PANAMA, Nov. 22 -- The Weston-Carr expedition, now exploring the Goajira Peninsula in Colombia, has made some interesting discoveries regarding the habits of the Indians who inhabit the vast cactus-covered plains of the Goajira.

headline.main: FIND THE GOAJIRAS HAVE NO RELIGION; But American Explorers Say Colombian Tribe Believes in an After Life.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28. -- A promise that the United States will deal with other countries in the utmost frankness was made by Secretary of State Cordell Hull as he and his party arrived today at Montevideo to attend the Pan-American Conference.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 30 (AP). -- War in the Gran Chaco between Bolivia and Paraguay, a two-year-old skeleton in the South American closet, was brought into discussions preliminary to the Pan-American Conference today by Jose Manuel Puig...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 30 (AP). -- War in the Gran Chaco between Bolivia and Paraguay, a two-year-old skeleton in the South American closet, was brought into discussions preliminary to the Pan-American Conference today by Jose Manuel Puig Casauranc, Mexican Foreign Minister.
docs.abstract: Truce urged at Pan Amer Conf

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Nov. 30. -- Latin-American debts to United States investors are casting a shadow of discord over the outwardly harmonious feeling of the delegations arriving for the opening of the Pan-American Conference Sunday.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 1 -- There is a distinct swing toward an optimistic outlook in expectancy of concrete beneficial results as the date approaches for the opening of the seventh Pan-American conference here. This is in sharp contrast to the air of...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 1 -- There is a distinct swing toward an optimistic outlook in expectancy of concrete beneficial results as the date approaches for the opening of the seventh Pan-American conference here. This is in sharp contrast to the air of pessimism and doubt which hung over the conference arrangements as recently as two weeks ago.
docs.abstract: Pays informal visits to heads of Pan-Amer Conf delegations to cement cordiality

headline.main: MONTEVIDEO SPIRIT IS MORE OPTIMISTIC; Hope for Real Results Grows as Tendency Increases to Accept Compromises. HULL WINS WIDE ESTEEM Pays Informal Visits to Heads of Pan-American Delegations to Cement Cordiality.
